Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The intended process is R -> A -> loop -> XOR -> C, but additional anomalies were noticed in the POWL model.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The loop defined in the code involves repeated execution of E and P for evaluation and approval, but the loop condition permits early exits, reducing the assurance of full approvals after evaluations.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The edge A -> C in the strict partial order of the model enables the possibility of claims being prematurely closed without undergoing proper evaluation and approval.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: An XOR operator between N and skip introduces the possibility of skipping customer notifications entirely, violating the intended stepwise process.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Queries were suggested to validate whether significant anomalies occur in real event data. Observed patterns (e.g., claims closing post A without E and P) may falsely appear as acceptable cases.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Suggested SQL queries verify claim processing anomalies such as claims approved multiple times or closed without proper approvals.
